Material used.Material Source: Fibroblasts from a patient affected by early-onset Parkinsonism carrying the homozygous W437X nonsense mutation in the PINK1 gene
Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using fibroblasts from a patient affected by early-onset Parkinsonism carrying the homozygous W437X nonsense mutation in the PINK1 gene.

Readout description.Conclusion: Lower respiratory activity and a decreased respiratory control ratio were observed compared to normal fibroblasts.
Readout description.Result Description: Cellular ATP supply relied mainly on enhanced glycolytic production in the patient's fibroblast mitochondria.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed, but this information is not explicitly stated in the literature. However, based on typical experimental design, it can be inferred that multiple biological replicates were likely performed.

Basic positive control.Description: A basic positive control was set up using normal fibroblasts.

Basic negative control.Description: A basic negative control was set up using an empty vector or a control sample without the PINK1 gene mutation.
